trans-unit.source: Apache Tika: If ticked, Apache Tika will be used to detect and extract metadata from your assets.
exiftool: If ticked, external tool "exiftool" will be used to detect and extract metadata from your assets.
pdfinfo: If ticked, external tool "pdfinfo" will be used to detect and extract metadata from your assets.
Native PHP: If ticked, native PHP code and libraries will be used to detect and extract metadata from your assets.

Base directory for mapping: The metadata extraction requires mapping configuration files. By default these are provided in the Configuration/Services directory. If you wish to use a different mapping configuration, you can provide a different mapping configuration base directory.

Tika Application Path: Path to your Apache Tika application jar file (tika-app-x.x.jar). This path may be relative to the root of your website or absolute. Download the jar from https://tika.apache.org/download.html
Tika Server Host: Host running the Apache Tika server.
Tika Server Port: Port on the Apache Tika server.
exiftool: Absolute path to external program "exiftool". Leave empty if not available.
pdfinfo: Absolute path to external program "pdfinfo". Leave empty if not available.

This tool helps you configuring the mapping between the output of a metadata extraction service and FAL by suggesting how to write a mapping configuration line in the JSON files stored within the directory configured above. Please note that it does not support all bells and whistles described in the documentation but it should help you kickstart your own setup.
Start by choosing a file in the dropdown list, then click on any metadata property to transfer it to the text area showing you what to write in your mapping configuration file.
Some sample files are provided by this extension, but you may analyze your own pictures by storing them within directory __USERDIR__.
